alert.note: Alert for Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 5:09AM MST until January 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...MOUNTAIN SNOW TO CONTINUE OVER WESTERN AND NORTHERN NEW MEXICO TODAY... .As a low pressure system crosses the Four Corners area and moves into Colorado, light to moderate snow will persist over western and central New Mexico today. Additional accumulations of 2 to 4 inches will be common in the mountains above 7,500 feet with locally higher amounts on higher peaks above 10,000 feet. Areas of reduced visibility and snow-packed roads will be possible. Snow will decrease in intensity this evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and locally up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Southwest Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
